supporting_snippets.sentence: Exposure to microgravity for 30 days resulted in a significant 15% reduction in bone mineral density in weight-bearing bones.
Microgravity conditions induced accelerated bone loss through increased osteoclastic activity.
Prolonged spaceflight leads to substantial decreases in bone density, particularly in the hip and spine regions.
Space radiation exposure resulted in elevated levels of DNA double-strand breaks in all tested cell types.
Ionizing radiation significantly increases DNA damage markers and oxidative stress responses.
Resistance exercise protocols effectively mitigated muscle mass loss during simulated microgravity exposure.
Daily exercise regimens showed significant protective effects against microgravity-induced muscle atrophy.
Spaceflight conditions altered immune cell distribution and cytokine production patterns.
Microgravity exposure modulated T-cell activation and antibody responses.

contradicting_snippets.sentence: No significant changes in immune function were observed during short-duration exposure.

supporting_snippets.sentence: Intermittent artificial gravity significantly reduced bone mineral density loss compared to control groups.
